Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: After 8 weeks travelling throughout Europe Corona was our last Hotel,we stayed here for 2 weeks in late oct 2011.On the positive side it is close to Termini rail station,easy walking distance with luggage.It is also relatively close to most attractions in Rome,we walked daily and found it a pleasant walk always finding more attractions and feeling totally comfortable finding our way back with ease.The rooms are small and dingy and very basic,reasonably clean with daily bed making etc.Bathroom clean and ample hot water.Wifi was not good and not free,although It did function most of the time.The included breakfasts were very basic and most people were disappointed,we saw many first timers come and go feeling let down.Food is put out in small rations to minimise use so be patient but don't expect much.Staff are reasonably pleasant and helpful with maps etc but only a very basic assistance.For the money I believe there are better options,but if you are happy with no frills and need proximity to termini rail station it may suit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent low cost option in a convenient location with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarkB2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within walking distance of most of the main historical attractions. The Vatican can be reached on foot in about 30 minutes but if walking isn't your thing their is a metro station 5 mins away. You can get unlimited public transport for 3 days for €3. The hotel staff are all very friendly and the their is a cosy family feel. The hotel is low cost but excellent value for money. Breakfast is continental but their is good selection. Their is a lovely restaurant right next door for the evening and their are many restaurants, cafes and bars within walking distance. If you are on a limited budget you won't be disappointed with this hotel. I ave paid much more and got much less. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnemiekRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice hotel to stay, right in the center of Rome, good value& service, nearby the Termini station and walking distance (10 minutes). The beds and bathroom are good, the room is not too big, but like I said good value for money. the staff is very friendly and brakfast is nice! Apart from that it is nicely situated to all the highlights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romina A
Reviews.Content: The hotel Crowns is a very good hotel. The price is identical to the service. Very good attention and predisposition of the employees. The rooms are pretty and complete. The breakfast is very rich, abundant and varied. Even it is croissant warm. The hall of entry is very wide and agreeable. I recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!”
Reviews.Author: Herman P
Reviews.Content: I had the dis-pleasure in staying at this inhospitable hotel. My 21 day holiday started in London, then Paris, Venice, Florence and finally ended in Rome. Every hotel we stayed in out did the last and we were enjoying every bit of our holiday and then we went to Rome! When the transfer company struggled to even find the hotel, I started to get a bit concerned. The hotel is literally hidden in a dingy & dodgy dead end. We were greeted with, " sorry we can't assist with your luggage, there's no porter at this hotel!" Firstly, the attitude of the hotel manager was appalling. He clearly demonstrated that he was highly frustrated with his job and that he didn't have the owners best interest in mind. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and regretted every second of it. I cannot understand why my travel agent even booked this dreadful hotel compared to the rest of the hotels for this holiday. Secondly, the room had a damp stench in it and the beddings to the carpets on the floor were kept in horrid condition. My daughter compared the bathroom/toilet to that of a hospital. My biggest problem was the blatant attitude towards the hotel guests. Does the management team at this hotel not realize that they need the tourists future business?? Would it hurt them to at least pretend to be friendly??Just based on the hotel managers comment to the couple that was robbed in December, he was not apologetic just defensive!! The owner of this establishment should genuinely look into sending some of his staff on some service and hospitality courses and look into these criticisms constructively. Herman SA

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome in December”
Reviews.Author: Stan A
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to take my mom flying and to the Vatican for the first time in her life. Booked this hotel after reading mostly positive reviews on Dutch websites. We were looking for a simple hotel at a reasonable location. The location is great if you like to be able to walk to the various spots in the touristic center like we did. But the location itself is not in the safest area of Rome so you have to take a few precautions with your belongings but to be honest you have to do that in every city. The room was simple but clean and everything was working except the cooler, but possibly no one uses the cooler in December in Italy but us. The reception staff was helpful and able to help and advise us also on how and where to go in Rome. The breakfast area was characteristic with simple but diverse food also taking in account international travelers. (butter and milk etc.) The old Italian lady providing breakfast and my mom became best friends though they could only talk with hands and feet, but things like that make such a trip more memorable. All in all a simple hotel like we wanted but clean and simply good with helpful staff in a central location from the main tourist attractions. Would book this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed right outside the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: My wife had her necklace ripped off her neck at 18:30 on a Sunday evening. The mugging happened about 40 meters from the Corona. I chased the mugger right by the owner of the Corona and his son who were talking on the sidewalk. I screamed at them to stop him, but they just ignored me. I came back and told them I was staying at the Corona and asked why they didn't stop him, they indicated that they didn't want to get involved. After further discussion it almost appeared that they felt these criminals had to eat so it was ok for them to rob tourists. They kept referring to the War (Libya) going on and the refugees and the fact that these refugees had to eat. The area surrounding the hotel is nice, but the hotel itself is located on a series of back streets. The hotel was nice enough, but the indifference of the owner to the crime in his neighborhood was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Hot water it's basic”
Reviews.Author: Nettup
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic, the rooms very small (2.5 * 3 Sq M) but clean. The staff was OK. We were surprised at night that the water in the shower were lukewarm. (It was 8 degrees out side). The reception guy that came to check, said: "for me it's the right temperature for a shower so it's your personal opinion that the water not worm enough". In the morning the water was cold, but we understood that it won't help us to complain. The breakfast was fine. If you are coming for 1 or 2 nights, and you are not planning on spending time at the room beside sleeping, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Erez T
Reviews.Content: Staff is great, place is cozy and warm but the rooms are not small. The location is what makes this place shine as it is close to the Termini station (walking distance) so you don't have to carry the luggage around the city. Also, there is a bike/scooter rental place just across the street and these are the two best ways to travel the city. There is also a great restaurant adjacent to the hotel, it is also highly recommended. I would say that for my next trips to Rome I know where I would be staying.

Reviews.Title: “could be cheaper...”
Reviews.Author: margarete p
Reviews.Content: It´s a very comfortable hotel in a very good part of Rome. 8 minutes walk from Termini but with a very pleasant surround, plenty of shops and restaurants. 3 minutes from Santa Maria Maggiore, 25 minutes from via del Corso. Near two subways. The street is very quiet. The hotel has a nice appearance, nice decoration, immaculate clean, everyday cleaning service, rooms furbished with brand new decoration and furniture, marvelous bed, no strange smelling or noises. Tv, good shower, desk. Complete continental breakfast: fruits, tea, juice, bread, toasts, crispyies etc. Lift and nice sitting rooms. Very nice and helpful staff, spoke French, Spanish and English too. That relieved me, because of so many reviews here talking about rude staff (they are common in Italy). They sell bottles of water and I found everything very organized. I chose it after reading tripadvisors´ reviews, and didn´t regret. But it shouldn´t be so expensive, for Internet was not include (10 euros unlimited use) and using safe in bedroom was paid in separate too. I guess it is too expensive for backpackers, but in Rome there seem to be no good and cheap hotel…

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Judith P
Reviews.Content: The Corona Hotel ticked all the boxes for us as to location, service, cleanliness, ambience. Perfect for us. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “hotel corona”
Reviews.Author: traveller293984
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in three years in this hotel .The location is great! Everything in a walking distance .the service and help of the staff is very good. this time we got a bigger room with a balcony which was great in the mornings. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast is good ( better then 3 years ago ). There is a market downstairs and a supermarket few steps away and a huge number of restaurants . We enjoyed every minute . I am sure that next time in rome i will stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Corona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Corona Hotel in September 2011. I had stayed in several hotels during my tour of Italy, London and Paris and this was without a doubt the most comfortable bed I had slept in. It was nice waking up refreshed each morning and without an aching back for a change! We had a clean room, very good shower, the location was central whether you decided to go by foot to some of the major sites or opt for public transport and the staff were very helpful. I'd especially like to thank Patricia for going out of her way to assist us with our itinerary - Rome is such a large city to navigate and she gave us some useful information on sites that were worth visiting besides the usual touristy places, along with suggestions on places to eat and ways to get around. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please, please look for a different hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liljoey76
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed at on our 17 day trip to Italy and it was one of the worst. Charges for everything (10 euro for wifi/day, 5 euro/day for the safe, no local calls without a charge). We had a travel agent take care of hotels, so we thought we'd be ok. breakfast was included with our room and definitley not worth it, unless all you want is coffee cake, bread and jam. if you wanted to turn the A/C on, 25 euro a day. We would have loved to leave our window open, but the street noise was unbearable and every day there was a market that set up on the street (starting at 5 am). We asked if we could change rooms, but no twin beds on the interior side. Our last day in Rome, there was a terrible rain storm in the morning, and water was coming into the corridors of the floors! The staff in the morning were always rude. The woman who worked the front desk late afternoon was always courteous. The room was very small. I couldn't open the closet door without pushing the beds and nightstands all the way to the exterior wall. I'm dissappointed our travel agent thought this would work for us. I would never recommend this hotel to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “10 days at the Corona”
Reviews.Author: Pam101011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent all of our time in Italy in Rome and found that staying in one hotel was perfect. Corona is a family owned hotel with high standards for their renovations, excellent housekeeping and a lovely breakfast daily which saved us at least 20 euros daily. Getting to know the family and their staff was a highlight for us. Their English was much better than our minimal Italian. We truly felt we had a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Corona hotel”
Reviews.Author: corcort
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at the Corona. The room was quite small, but fine for my needs. It was clean and comfortabland the shower was very good. The coomn areas were very attractive and there was a local market right outside the door. It was verry convenient to Termini Station and many tourist sites. The staff were very friendly and also speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: tanya3993
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in the Corona Hotel for 2 nights so that we could do a bit of sightseeing. On our arrival, we were greeted by a lady we assumed was the manager, very friendly and let us deposit our bags while we went out for the day. We were given a map with directions of the best places to experience, which was very useful. The room itself was clean, tidy with air conditioning (bliss when you have been sight-seeing all day in 40 degree heat!). The breakfast was quite nice, with a wide variety of cereals, toast, baguettes, cakes and fruit. The Hotel was easy to find and in a good central location. We found a lovely restaurant around the corner from the Hotel called Alessios (very quaint!) and was down some steps into a garden, with friendly staff and very italian! I would recommend going early as it was very busy around 8.30pm (people were queuing!). There wasn't much choice in terms of restaurants as it was the holiday period when we visited, however it wasn't so busy, which was quite nice. I would recommend the hotel, we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A small, fine, family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because of the persona service, the friendly help, the fact that the staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. We loved that it was family and that we could talk about stuff with them. We got lots of hints and advice about things which we could never have gotten from a guidebook. The rooms were adequate, it was very quiet, and all was kept quite clean. If w needed anything, we got it right away. Very pleasurable and worth it......Also the location was excellent both for public transportation and walking to lots of sites and museums.....Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussiecouple258
Reviews.Content: The room was too small for 2 adults with 2 suitcases and 2 backpacks. The shower area was also very small and as a large adult male I struggled to fit into the recess to shower. Breakfast was only average and we had to pay for WIFI in our room. The staff however were very helpful to us and once we had our bearings, the hotel is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Corona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilu72
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is well situated in a quiet residential area, yet close to Termini Station and the main tourist attractions - Colosseum, Forum Romano, Piazza Venezia, Trevi Fountain and Piazza di Spagna are only a brief stroll away. Our room was clean with a comfortable double bed and clean white crispy sheets, a powerful air conditoning and LDC screen TV - bathroom had a shower of good size and complimentary soaps with good size clean towels; our room had as well a nice balcony which was essential to a smoker such as my husband. The lobby and the breakfast room were lovely and well appointed; every morning we could see energetic and smiling women cleaning up the tables for the next guests - breakfast is as well well presented with a variety of breads, cereals and cakes .... the spreadable cheese was very yummy indeed! The area is as well pleasant and there are restaurants all around and well lit at night. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to friends and family since courtesy and kindness are well in place at this hotel by all staff. Thanks you Luciano and Emanuela to have make our stay very comfortable and enjoable!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room and breakfast. Clean but noisy. Very good staff.”
Reviews.Author: Late88
Reviews.Content: Location is very good for explore room during short weekend brake. If somebody want stay longer and spend more time in room should consider other options. However price is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ankime
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Corona Hotel for 4 nights in July 2011. The staff was very friendly and helpful giving us a map on the first day and showing the main attractions of the city. The hotel is in a very good location- close to Termini, Santa Maria Maggiore and Via Nationale with all major sites at walking distance. We have used the metro only once, for Vatican, but we could have walked to there as well. The room was small but very clean. We loved the living room, with a very nice piano and the breakfast room - very nicely decorated. Breakfast is great for the start of a long visiting day, but the same everyday. The hotel doesnt have free Wifi, but you can purchase from the reception a 10eur card with unlimited access. The only problem was that for half of our stay, the internet was down. For sure, the hotel it's worth the money we paid for. I recommend it to friends who want to spend holidays in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff- okay room”
Reviews.Author: jcakes13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in a pretty small room. The bathroom was always clean, and the air conditioning worked well which is important in the summer, and not always the case in the smaller hotels. The room was not carpeted, and the floors felt that they had dirt/film on them. I tried to keep socks on. The location is also pretty decent. The women at the breakfast buffet were nice, but the selection was poor. Bread, rolls, toast, cake, cereal...carb fest. We probably wouldn't stay here again, but if you're on a budget it's not bad. In addition, it is really close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel close to via Natiioanle.”
Reviews.Author: btj123
Reviews.Content: Great service, small but clean rooms with air con and a great italian breakfast included in the price. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Little and ugly”
Reviews.Author: yankeerome
Reviews.Content: Rude staff - tiny hotel which is definitely not quaint. We arrived early and wanted to deposit our bags until the room was ready - they told us to go up the ramp and leave them there. We thought there would be a bell boy and a room - etc. There was a sort of living room with many bags. We decided to drag our bag with us - since we had medicine and other personal items inside. When we finally got in the room it was tiny and ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: WackieWackers
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated near to the Termini (train/bus station). Lovely breakfast, fresh fruit, coffee and a selection of sweet cakes. Very nice restaurant right next door, serving authentic Italian food. They supply a very detailed map of Rome and all the sights. We were able to walk to just about all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, and next-door restaurant was terrific”
Reviews.Author: ajkaye
Reviews.Content: I had a single room, quite small but with an excellent bathroom and shower. The room was scrupulously clean. Decent breakfast. Very convenient for the main station (Roma Termini). The staff were friendly and helpful. It is in a good area for quality restaurants at reasonable prices, and the one next door (the "Boheme") was really excellent. Rome is an easily walkable city and the hotel is well-placed for setting off to see the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying at the Corona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATJ_52
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Rome, and hopefully, not my last. I found the hotel and staff very accommodating and friendly. They helped arrange my tours and answered my many questions. The location couldn't have been better - so many sites with-in walking distance and the Termini. Breakfast was very good with fresh fruit and many selections. Great coffee. Everyone's English was so much better than my Italian! The room was small but clean and comfortable. This family run hotel helped make my experience in Rome everything I'd hoped for in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma”
Reviews.Author: farthews
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from my second stay at the Corona Hotel.Luciano and his team make you feel at home and are there to help with any questions that you may have. The room was on the small size but very clean,besides how long do you spend in your room on a city break? Breakfast was even better than last year with fresh fruit,cereals,meats,cheese,breads,preserves and various cakes.There was always fruit juice and tea,coffee etc. My husband and I really enjoyed our stay and I was able to guide him around Rome as last year my stay was extended due to the volcanic ash cloud. Hope to stay at the Corona again.Thank you Luciano.

Reviews.Title: “We are back again this year (for the fourth time):)”
Reviews.Author: dolinski
Reviews.Content: A very pleasent place with perfect breakfest. Coffee incredible with croissants. Family atmosphere and a very good hotel for sightseeing on foot. Andrzej

Reviews.Title: “Delightfull and charming”
Reviews.Author: prosatty1010
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many wonderful and charming features. The lounge and breakfast areas have many interesting pictures, statuetes, books and "knicknacks" The breakfast was the best we had in three weeks of our stay in Italy. The desk personel were extremely helpful. Their recommendations for dinning were righton. The only drawback was the smallness of the room, but, since we intended to tour and to use the room only to sleep, it was more than acceptable. When in Rome, we definately will stay at the Carona again.

Reviews.Title: “the best place to be in rome”
Reviews.Author: bibamoses
Reviews.Content: Clean well situated nice people excellent breakfast All in all 100 % marks to this family owned business Biba moses

Reviews.Title: “I Love Italy - Stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: atag40
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend hotel Corona for its convenient location and the friendly (English speaking front desk) staff. My wife and I decided to shell out the extra cash to stay in the city center because she is pregnant. It was money well spent as it saved us substantial time getting around. This is a quaint little hotel with comfortable beads and just about everything you may need from a clean place to sleep. The breakfast is simple but very nicely presented and robust enough to fill the most discerning of stomachs. If you ask the cafeteria staff nicely enough (and possibly in Italian) they may even make you a cup of espresso instead of the filtered stuff. Last word of advice for thous traveling in Italy (or anywhere ells for that matter), if your looking for a restaurant with a view you will find one anywhere. If your looking for authentic Italian food listen for people speaking Italian patronizing the place...

Reviews.Title: “Please see below”
Reviews.Author: BebbeAlingsas
Reviews.Content: Regret but our expectations of a ***star hotel is far higher theean what we experienced. Poor breakfast with NO fresh fruit, vegetables, cheese, egg etc etc. Maintenance of room very poor. NO VALUE FOR OUR MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Scam hotel-beware do not stay”
Reviews.Author: pupfox
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of traveling and this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in the last fifteen years. The hotel is off the beaten path, by itself, in dark and undesirable area. Further the host at the counter will attempt to charge you what he calls body tax (2 Euros per body in room per day) and you can only pay in cash for the body tax when you leave. The breakfast in the morning is pathetic with horrible coffee, various rolls were hard and it is hard to find napkins. Further there is construction and the rooms are very noisy and small. We had a double and it was only a bed with a shower and toilet that leaked. There are gypsies and panhandlers during the day asking you for monies when you leave and this was rated 3 stars by this service. It should be more a negative 3 stars. The sheets are not clean and they charge you for wifi when they say it is free $10.00 Euros a day per device and it does not work. Watch yourself if you stay at this hotel and your possessions. The cleaning person left the stick in the toilet (classic) fits hotel

Reviews.Title: “Where not to stay!”
Reviews.Author: doubledutch313
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny as was shower, bed uncomfortable, elevator tiny so walking up many stairs to be expected; breakfast included but light; Staff was not helpful or friendly; infact this was the only hotel in Italy that informed us of a "city tax" that was due at the end of our stay. It would only be acceptable in cash of course! I do not recommend this hotel in any way!

Reviews.Title: “Owner yelled at us for attempting to eat gelato in lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Ebbauman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a crap-shoot. Sub-par everything... Can't say I've stayed in a worse place other than a hostel in Venice. For starters, we were sold an Internet card with a log-in that the front desk put on our iPhone, that later we wanted to use for our laptop and were told we couldn't or pay another €10. Regardless that we didn't choose to use our phone in the first place, they did. Second, the owner was in the lobby when we walked in with fresh gelatos to relax before heading back out to site see an yelled at us for coming in to do. Told us to return to the gelato place to eat and not ruin his apolstery. Fun as it is, this place serves breakfast and the lobby was jammed with coffee drinkers and kids snaking on croissants and jam this morning. Lastly, and worst of all, the owner proceeded to berate me because I was an American. Ironically, I live in Madrid and attend the most diverse of the top-10 business schools in the world, but I speak English and am from the US, so I suspect that means I'm a typical American tourist. Sadly, he made my wife cry and storm off, but that wasn't enough for him. He continued to lash out on how we should have known there was no eating in the lobby and blah blah blah... There's not much more to say. I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone considering our exchange out of principle. It's ridiculously far from the main sites and you may want to save some cash by picking it, but you'll regret it after you realize how far everything is and your feet will hate you for days. Enjoy your trip to Roma, and remember you were warned if you get yelled at at the Hotel Corona.

Reviews.Title: “We felt part of the family at the Corona!”
Reviews.Author: Melennon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We felt safe and well looked after!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel- Just what I was hoping to find for my visit!”
Reviews.Author: GladTraveler02
Reviews.Content: A great location out of the tourist noise but convenient to transportation for all the beauty of Rome. Some evenings I even walked back to the hotel from different sites. My room was perfect , comfortable for a solo traveler - beautiful window that opened onto the back courtyard – when I opened the window in the evening I could hear the faint sounds of Roman families having supper & each morning upon waking, I opened the shutters which flooded the room with sunlight. Otherwise very quiet. Always great water pressure in my bathroom! Fabulous morning coffee in the breakfast room. The Hotel staff was wonderful. Each morning they would help me map out a route to my daily destinations, gave personal suggestions for restaurants or searched the web for well rated ones - all were perfect. They also had brochures to some of the local restaurants. The staff were also kind enough to help me with travel time for reaching destinations, best times to frequent certain sites & they arranged for taxi's when I needed it. There is a wonderful little church on the corner which has classical concerts some evenings. This was a wonderful convenient surprise. I highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful desk staff, clean rooms, within easy reach of many locations”
Reviews.Author: tchanrahan
Reviews.Content: Arrived approximately 10.30 am. Rooms ready for immediate occupancy. On checking in we were given a map of Rome and directions to many famous sites which we discovered were within pleasant walking distance of the hotel. Staff at reception always corteous and friendly. Our rooms were cleaned daily and changes of towels and bed linen frequent. Breakfasts were generous, more than enough for a morning's activities. Good restaurants nearby and the added bonus of being in such close proximity to the Opera House and St Paul's within the walls where we spent two delightful evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeremyBaldwin
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Hotel Corona for several years with groups and am always impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the great location of the hotel. The rooms are small, but clean and pleasant. The breakfast is basic, but generous. The lobby and sitting room on the first floor are roomy and comfortable. You can walk most places in Rome from there and the subway is very close. I recommended it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SianEWilliams
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with a fab location, in walking distance to everything. The rooms are small but adequate, you're in Rome you don't want to stay in the hotel the whole time, there is too much to see outside. The bathroom was lovely as well. The rooms are a little noisy but nothing too bad. The breakfasts are great and surprisingly fill you up for a good while. The blood orange juice is fantastic. On getting to the hotel it was easy to find and we had a lovely reception and we were given a map of the area and told about some tours that they do from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RhonddaRedDragon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location with a daily market just outside the door, however, it was not noisy in the rooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were always clean and the breakfast had a good selection (although no cooked food). Any hotel that can put up with 7 Welsh boys on a rugby tour must be good;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rjlevy14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! Rooms were small and outdated but seemed clean. Staff wasn't very helpful to us. It was very loud when people were talking in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice at the Hotel Corona”
Reviews.Author: Muzzymoo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Corona is a lovely hotel for a visit to Rome. Ideally situated near the Termini train/tube/bus station you can easily get around the city especially with the Roma pass (25 Euros). Or you can walk, it's not too far. Being away from the centre it is quieter. The staff are extremely helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Not sure if it is family run but it has that feel about it! Our room was on the first floor at the back of the hotel so generally quiet apart from some noise from the trattoria next door. It was very clean and comfortable, with a nice bathroom and doors out onto a small balcony . The ground floor is lovely, with a quiet rooms with books and sofas, and a spacious breakfast room in the basement. Good breakfast which sets you up for the day, always fresh. There is a daily market in the adjacent street where you can buy picnic food. Car parking if you need it is a block away. We stayed for 4 nights and it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, clean rooms, simple breakfast in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: cjp79
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel, the staff were always courteous and helpful, the breakfast was a cold buffet - simple but did the job - and the top floor room we were given was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the Buck.”
Reviews.Author: bnordholt
Reviews.Content: This cheap hotel is well worth your money. It has everything except its own restaurant. Rooms are small as you would expect in Rome, but clean and neat. There’s WIFI for a small fee which is fast and reliable. Included in the price is breakfast in a nice dinning room, in other hotels in Rome you would rather skip the breakfast, but not on Hotel Corona, good selection and quality prepares you for the days sightseeing. The location is perfect for sightseeing either on foot or by public transportation. Via Nazionale is 2 minutes away on foot and from there you can catch a bus that goes straight to Piazza Venezzia with only two stops.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumQ
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, walking distance from most attractions in Rome center. Friendly helpful staff. Desk guy gave us some good advice about restaurants and places to visit. Rooms are not very big, but clean and the necessary is there. We had the luck to have a room with a big roof terrace though : )

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeahReading
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as wanted somewhere convenient to stay that was within close proximity to the sights of Rome. The hotel had great reviews and had a good location so we booked. The rooms are small but were sufficient for what we wanted, a base for the night and somewhere to shower. The hotel at first seemed to be quite peaceful and we looked forward to having a good nights sleep, however were awaken numerous times as you could hear everything within the hotel, cleaners moving around, a market being set up in the mornings outside. Although we knew in advance that a continental breakfast was included in the price of our stay, the quality was pretty poor. There were literally a few types of cake/ croissant, toast and wafer thin ham. The coffee was disgusting and tasted like sludge and the orange juice was really weak like orange squash. For the most part we didn't even bother with breakfast after the first time we tried it. On our last day we realised that check out was at 10am, which is generally really early for hotels. Our flight was quite late at night and we enquired to see if it was possible to pay and stay in the room longer, even an hour or two. The hotel wouldn't accommodate this and we felt it was a bit rigid and that the best service hadn't been provided. Overall our stay was that bad, the hotel served it's purpose however the breakfast and customer service was very poor. We had managed to get this hotel at a discounted rate of 100 euros per night as opposed to the top price but I don't feel the hotel was worth this much money and was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Noopy912
Reviews.Content: I'll just pass the room size and all, but why can't they offer the coffeepot with or without deposit? And there's no refrigerator, though that was not the first I met, but 5 euros a day to use the safe? (I didn't use it -would you?) I read in a review that wifi is free when staying 3 or more days, but didn't know it was from the fourth day! Well, the location's not bad as it is 10 minutes' walk from the Termini station, but there's really so much to be desired with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably sanitary room reminiscent of hotels you were stuck in when you traveled as a teenager with your highschool”
Reviews.Author: chrispigirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Rome and had booked a room at Hotel Tea. Unfortunately, someone had refused to check out, so we were sent to Hotel Corona for one night. While I am pickier with hotels, my boyfriend is not. Both of us were highly disappointed in Hotel Corona. Since we had paid for Hotel Tea, I am not sure what the price would be and whether the hotel is a good deal. The sheets looked clean, but they were torn in several places. The quilt looked disgusting and seemed like it had not been cleaned in a very very long time. The bathroom toilet seemed clean, but neither of us were willing to use the shower, which looked covered in mildew and again, disgusting. The area was decentish and closer to tourist sights than Hotel Tea. All in all, it depends on what type of hotels you feel comfortable staying in. I went on several school trips to Europe years ago while I was in high school. This hotel reminded me of those hotels. I never liked them back then, but I dealt with them. Now that I am older and can choose my own hotels, I prefer to do something a little less... undesirable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, quiet, clean, affordable room.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferK7217
Reviews.Content: We absolutly loved our stay! We traveled with a 10 year old child and found that the location of this hotel was ideal. There were many places nearby to eat, and affordable shopping on the nearby main strip (Via Nationale). We actually booked a second hotel for one night the second leg of our trip and ended up returning to the area surrounding this hotel as it was safe, clean, and lively. It is very close to Termini Station, Republica Metro stop, and walking distance from many of the major sites. There is also a great little market just outside the hotel doors every morning. The hotel staff is some of the friendliest in Europe, and is very helpful to point out great places to eat and to help navigate Rome's winding streets. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast, fresh breads and pasties, toast, fruit, cold ceral and coffee, tea and juice. We thought it was just enough to start our day. The room was spacious, clean, had plenty of room for suitcases, and had a good shower with excellent water pressure. We will definitly stay again, and refer to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Corona is a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Domitia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about ten minutes walk from Termini Station, and down hill, brilliant when you have arrived from Fiumicino airport by train and have a heavy suitcase to drag. Furthermore it is within walking distance of a number of the major sites, especially the Roman ones. For the Classicists out there, it is between the Esquiline and the Viminal Hills. The hotel is beautifully clean and has nice, modern ensuites. It has a great ambience and prints of famous paintings adorn the walls of the rooms and the main areas. (I particularly like the Botticelli in the breakfast room.) The staff are warm and friendly and very helpful. I have stayed in the Corona several times and would be happy to recommend it. Various excursions can be arranged through the hotel and Luciano actually got us tickets to see Aida at the Baths of Caracalla. Check out the Strega Restaurant nearby which has lovely food and great staff. Hillshills

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: review2010Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Corona for 5 nights on business. I was in a single superior room which was clean and tidy. Hotel location is very convenient. 15 mins walk to/from Termini Station and similarly convenient to Via Nazionale, Colloseum etc. During the day, there is a market set up outside the hotel selling a variety of stuff. Overall a cheap and cheerful staying experience.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - good staff and location”
Reviews.Author: jddorian
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. The reception was very helpful, the common rooms were large and spacious and the location was good. The room was a decent size, but it had a slight odor - like someone had smoked in the room and they still didn't have it aired out. The bathroom was decent but the water pressure was horrible. I have very thick hair and had to wash my hair in the sink. There was no way I could do it in that shower! The first night the hotel was quiet. The next two nights we heard water, shower/ toilet sounds from the other rooms all night long. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the station. We found a better route once we had been there a day or so. It's down a quiet street, but there is a street market during the week. It was a little hard to roll suitcases through the market. The reception gave us a map of Rome when we first arrived and recommended the Caio Roma bus tour (DON'T DO IT! - We did and regretted it. There are way better choices.) They told us about the close sights (a Cathedral, la Repubblica, etc) and the restaurant next door (we ate there twice - it was good). There is also a grocery store up the street - although it's not very recognizable as one from the outside. They have a lot of signs asking you not to eat in your rooms, but the common areas are large, so you may be able to do it there. Check out was early (10am), but we could keep our luggage there and they had a bathroom in the common area so we could clean up before leaving. I booked directly through the hotel website and paid less than $100 per night, so I guess I can't complain too much!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Marcia74
Reviews.Content: Last week my sister arrived in Rome 3 hours before me, only to discover that 1800hotels had cancelled our pre-paid reservation at Hotel Selene. The staff at the other hotel arranged a room for us at Corona Hotel. The Corona Hotel staff were very friendly to my sister and myself. We overslept the breakfast times and got a friendly call at the11:00 a.m. check-out time, which we also had slept through! We finally left at 11:30 and they let us keep our luggage with them until we sorted out our other reservation. The rooms are basic and clean and all that you need. It is located at the end of a quiet street. The restaurant next door was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: ldesai
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little hotel close to the Roma Termini. We booked this hotel because of the other reviews we have read. My wife and i stayed here from July 2 - July 6. It was a difficult hotel to find as it was hidden in an alley on Napoli street. If you stay at the hotel more than 3 nights..you do not have to pay for wireless internet. The hotel staff was nice and answered all questions we had. They suggested some places to eat and see. The restaurant right next to the hotel Corona..is a great restaurant...we ate their our first night and were not disappointed. The room was a little small but since it was just my wife and me...it was suitable. The shower was very small...but i guess all European hotels are about this size. The hotel was in a pretty good location. We walked to all the attractions. Be prepared to do a good amount of walking. The Roman coliseum and forum was about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The vatican was about a 25 - 30 minute walk from the hotel. Every other attraction was within 30 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The public transportation is very easy to use in Rome. There was a subway (Metro) stop near the hotel that could be used to get to many of the attractions. The breakfast was average...but it did the job to kick start our morning everyday. I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly, family operated, well located”
Reviews.Author: ruselneto
Reviews.Content: Good service and breakfast , family operated ,well located near plaza de la republica for metro and bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TooHard53
Reviews.Content: A good budget priced hotel for Rome (where hotels seem to be expensive). Has a very good central location - convenient to Termini (principal railway station) for access to the metro rail system and buses and also handy to many sites of interest. The area seemed to be quite safe and there are many places to eat nearby. Reception operates 24 hrs per day and staff are friendly, helpful and speak English. Room sizes are quite modest but I understand this should be expected in Rome, particularly in this price category. Buffet breakfast is quite simple and not one of the hotels stronger points. Have realistic expectations re room size and you can have a good stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “strictly Ok- am sure one can find much better places in Rome at this price”
Reviews.Author: Rishabh1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Corona for three nights from 12th-14th June , but would not recommend it to anyone . The hotel is located at a nice place, close to the central railway station and not too far from other places to see. But the praise ends here . There was no room service , the owner is a cranky , very bad mannered fellow in his mid-50s . The always spoke very rudely and treated his guests and if he is doing and favor to them by letting uthem stay there . On our first night , the hotel put us in a very small corner room which was big enough for monkeys to stay in ; it was only after our persistent requests did they gave us another slightly bigger room . even in that room , the shower was too small for an average size person to use it without hitting walls on all sides. They shut off the A/C in the middle of the night and when we inquired about the same in the morning , we were told that we should help them in saving electricity !!!, i can;t believe that someone would say that as an explanation to let the guests sleep in a room without proper cooling !!!! :( . The breakfast is strictly ok , not too much to eat anyways in what they provide . This hotel is a very very average one , stay in this hotel if you are unable to find anything else .Only the location is its saving grace !! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Decent No Frills Hotel for a few days”
Reviews.Author: SXA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Corona between June 1st and June 4th. The hotel is within walking distance of the Termini station. I would like to summarize our experience in bullet points: Close to Termini Station Free Wi-Fi . However in the room the signal was very weak and disappeared after midnight. It was puzzling to them as well. Clean Rooms Daily Housekeeping (except the first day when it appears they forgot) Free Breakfast (being from America it seems sparse, but its typical) Good Cappuccinos at Breakfast (We love the older lady who makes the cappuccinos she is wonderful) Very helpful staff. They speak excellent English. They have a street vendor market outside that sets up at 5am or so and it can be disruptive if you are facing the street. The market sells all kinds of things like Fruits, Household items, Clothes etc. This seems quite typical all over Italy where these markets get set up right on the street. They have signs saying no food allowed in the rooms..which seemed rather odd to us, since did that mean we could not even buy fruit or snacks to eat in the room? The stand up shower is small, and they had a shower curtain which did not cover the entire length of the shower so you had to be very careful not to cause flooding of the bathroom. Plenty of hot water. Bed was basic but reasonably comfortable. Pillows were hard (I am used to down pillows so perhaps thats why it felt that way to me). My girlfriend said it had more of a hostel feel to it than a hotel but in this price range I guess its typical. One morning they were playing some music in the hallway speaker which woke her up at 7am. Elevator is very tiny, if you are in the least bit claustrophobic you may want to take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: scuderia21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Corona for two nights while holidaying in Rome. Let's start with the good. It is very near Termini station which is the central station in Rome, so if you intend to take the train and metro everywhere in Rome (highly recommended!) it is very convenient. Also I love the lounge area which is very homely with it's big sofas and spacious quiet ambience. Breakfast was pretty good as well. However, it stops there. You had to pay 5 euros for the wi-fi which I couldn't receive any signal in my room, and I had to go to the lobby area everytime I wanted to use the internet. But the thing that really annoyed me was there was no room service. They had indicated that if you place your towels on the floor they would replace it for you. So we did, and went out the entire day to tour the city. When we returned at night, we realised nothing was done and we ended up using towels that had been left on the toilet floor again to dry ourselves. Also, we had already purchased tickets for the Vatican but would like to join a tour offered by the hotel, but we asked if we could pay the tour fee minus the ticket price, but they said no and didn't bother to help or be flexible. They just told me to throw my ticket away and join their tour. Overall it is clean, simple and neat and the location's great but service maybe not so.

Reviews.Title: “Roma”
Reviews.Author: EDD88
Reviews.Content: Staff was very accommodating. Breakfast was very tasty. The location is close to the Termini Metro Station and major bus station, making easy to get all around Rome quickly. Good free internet access, just ask the front desk for a code. The atmosphere was quiet relaxing. The rooms were clean, with good size with high ceilings. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful, Clean & Central”
Reviews.Author: Tripping75
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by some people I had met in New York earlier in the year. The location is perfect to walk to the most of the main tourist attractions. We found the room comfortable, and most surprisingly for such a small establishment, most languages were spoken and the staff were extremely professional and helpful. The gentleman on reception during our stay, Giacomo, was patient enough to give me information in Italian and then again in English for my wife, who is from London. There was a real famiy atmosphere at the hotel amongst the staff, I believe it is a family owned hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lil_explorer89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Corona Hotel while traveling with a large group of college students. The hotel was very nice and our rooms were very comfortable. There was more than enough room for 4 people to fit comfortably together in the same room. The breakfast was wonderful and consisted of a great variety of pastries to choose from. It made for a wonderful start to the day. The staff was also wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and more than willing to help with any problems or question we had along the way. The hotel is in a wonderful location, only a short walk from the train station, Via Nazionale, and all the main sites of Rome. My favorite part was the fact that the hotel offers free wi-fi which was wonderful for a college student trying to stay in touch with people back home. Overall, it was a great experience and i would definitely recommend this hotel to some traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: kckal024
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with a tour group from my college and it was one of the best places we stayed during our six week tour of Europe. The hotel staff was very helpful and assisted us was with everything that we needed. Our room was fabulous and kept very clean during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Hospitable, Charming.”
Reviews.Author: ShaynaBane
Reviews.Content: One of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. The staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious. The lobby was cozy. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very affordable and very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: mpvincent
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Hotel Corona since 2004 and I stay there with a group of students every other year. The service is always very friendly and very attentive, the location can't be beat (near Santa Maria Maggiore), and right off Via Nazionale. The hotel is convenient to a supermarket and pharmacy, and is a 10 minute walk from Termini. Luciano is an attentive owner, very accomodating, and speaks French, Spanish, and English fluently. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the breakfasts are fantastic. We always look forward to returning to Rome and staying at Hotel Corona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RayMilner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Friday 16th April 2010 as a result of the Icelandic volcano eruption. The hotel is very central for sightseeing, has a wondeful reception area and the rooms are very nice. Staff are friendly and efficient, English-speaking (if you haven't bothered to try a bit of Italian) and the food is very nice. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Preasantly Surprised Would Stay Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dodo101
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom very clean,nice and simple,can request size of rooms. location is perfect with in walking dist. to many sites and services.Breakfast is GREAT and plentifull with help full service. Lucky Uciano and family make you feel right at home and are most helpfull . The area is safe with a bank right next door and a security guard out side. Thank You !!! Monique & David Montreal Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: NobuyukiN
Reviews.Content: 3stars hotel, and I got a good service from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: BusterBB
Reviews.Content: My first stay in a european hotel so did not know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by the Corona Hotel. Very clean, the management so helpful and the breakfast better than we received in any other european hotel in that price range. It was the only place where getting a cup of coffee with breakfast was not a problem. The manager (I think it was a family business) went out of his way to help me with how, where and what should I expect to pay. If you are looking for luxury accomodation it is not the place but if you want cleanliness and caring staff this is the place. So central to everything. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location in the Caput Mundi”
Reviews.Author: arizonakoala
Reviews.Content: terrific location courteous well prepared staff spotless rooms hygienic facilities prompt medical assistance by us trained physician a great bargain in the capital of the world

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well situatued, excellent breakfast, only the room was a little constricted”
Reviews.Author: Mikalsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Corona Hotel for 6 days - on our first visit to Rome, and found the hotel most satisfactory, with a perfect location for us: near to The Central station, Via Nazionale, The Opera House, a church with classical concerts, and not far to walk to many of Rome's attractions - and nevertheless in a quiet street. The staff was nice, and the breakfast was plentiful. Our only objection was that the room was a bit small, but we had good sleep all the same. For sure, we would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “novice in rome”
Reviews.Author: goldenflyfisher
Reviews.Content: The Corona was a great find for our first trip to Rome. This small boutique hotel had a very handy location. You can walk to any site from this central location. An easy walk from the train station. The room and bathroom were larger than I anticipated. Very clean and the bed was very firm which my wife likes. The staff were extremely helpful. Uciano and his family were very friendly in a town where that is not always the case. The Trattatoria right next door had fantastic food . A lot of locals ate there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, very helpfull management.”
Reviews.Author: HIstorizon
Reviews.Content: A very good place, close to the historical centre, in a quiet street. In the morning a local market in front of the hotel. Clean and quiet rooms. Good breakfast. The management is very helpful to advise yoy for restaurants. Also other services can be organised by the management

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, family run hotel within walking distance of all major sights.”
Reviews.Author: ShezzaLancashire
Reviews.Content: I booked a 5 night stay in this hotel with a group of 6 friends for the England rugby game. The rooms, which comprised of double, twin and single accommodation, were very clean and serviced daily and although not particularly large, were big enough. Bathrooms had showers, complimentary soap, shower cream and hair dryer. A couple of our rooms found the toilet cistern extremely slow to re-fill after flushing so appeared initially to be in need of repair. Not good if you are rushing to leave the room! Because the hotel was busy, we were asked to give a time when we wanted breakfast. This was a continental breakfast which was buffet style and consisted of the usual fruit juices and hot drinks, and also, rolls and sliced breads, a toaster, cereals, an enormous glass bowl of fruit salad, plain yoghurt, one or two meats, cream cheese, a selection of jams and marmalade, and various cakes. There was never a need to rush this in the mornings. Although the hotel web-site did give details of an evening menu, there was no evidence of it providing any food other than the breakfast. Probably the only minus for the Corona was that there was no hospitality tray in the rooms and no other way to get tea or coffee - no machines in the reception area or room service. We had a meal in the Trattoria next door on our last night and wished we had eaten there earlier. An excellent meal, very good value and probably the best food we had whilst we were there. The hotel is very well placed near the Termini station and the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore basilica, and central enough to walk to all the city's remarkable sights. I would definately stay there again, but be aware - one of the reception staff - possibly the owner - was rather brusque to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station, and nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BootandBrats2009
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is proximity to the train station. We haven't travelled much, so arriving in Europe for the first time (in the rain) and navigating Rome as our first stop, it was much appreciated that the hotel was four blocks away. We planned on no taxis, no subways (and no bus in Rome), and getting there walking with our (carry-on) luggage was no problem. The hotel is close to Santa Maria Maggiore church. It is a bit of a hike to most other spots. We are young, healthy, and cheap - we walked twenty minutes to Vittorio Emanuel monument, 25 min to the Coliseum, 30 min to the Spanish Steps, and 35 min to the Vatican. If you dread walking on cobblestone and giving your knees and feet a workout, the hotel is a bit far from these sites. I'm not sure if it is a Rome thing, but we got better value at hotels in other cities in Europe. The room was fine, clean enough. The bathroom was small but it did the job. The tiny elevator was neat, and for those that complained about the size I thought it was a good effort on their part - the building was never designed to have an elevator! The breakfast room was cozy, and the breakfast was great -- this was the highlight of the hotel. Enjoyed the variety of fruit, juice, items to toast, and cereal. No complaints about the staff. However, we were puzzled on our last day - we got to Santa Maggiore Church early in the morning for Sunday Mass and it was locked. We asked the front desk, and they had no idea why. We even told them what time we thought it was, but later (after arriving an hour early for our train to leave Rome) we found out that the Europeans had switched their clocks back to standard time. Being tourists, and them being a hotel, I was surprised they never figured that out! Thank God it was not April, or we would have been an hour late and seriously annoyed instead of an hour early with a funny story to tell. Definitely a safe bet for a hotel, and I would recommend it, but shop around and compare, this hotel is not extra special!

Reviews.Title: “best deal for the its location in rome”
Reviews.Author: salvo9
Reviews.Content: T he Hotel Corona was a terrific deal for its location in Rome. The service was extremely efficient and very courteous. The rooms were comfartable. I would go back there anytime I need a Hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....convenient location, friendly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: hummersuv5
Reviews.Content: We spent our Thanksgiving holiday in Rome with our three teenage-young adult children. Corona Hotel was a great fit for us---convenient location since we walked to all the sites (Colosseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon) and only used the bus for our visit to St. Peter's Cathedral. The Terminal (bus/train) is about a 10 min. walk. The owners work in the hotel/front desk and are most gracious and helpful...speak English fluently! Small, clean rooms and good cold breakfast...great coffee! Suggest studying the system of buses--a bit confusing for us! Check out the Church of Santa Susanna (American) for their free Guide to Rome, www.santasusanna.org Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: traveler7982
Reviews.Content: Hotel corona is situated next to many great piazas, has very nice and simple rooms but mianly gives very good and friendly service. recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location for train travellers.”
Reviews.Author: JiggyJ61
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was very small, but reasonably clean, although the shower curtain had seen better days. When I arrived the room was lovely and cool, however the air conditioning was turned off in the middle of the night and wasn't turned back on for two days. Bare in mind I don't like heat, so some people may have enjoyed the warmer room. I was forced to open the window for some air and ended up being eaten alive by something. In it's favour the room had a very comfortable bed and the staff were reasonably helpful.

Reviews.Title: “could take it or leave it”
Reviews.Author: tkabj
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY clean but sparse. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't have a lot of street noise, but the first night there, I heard people next door come in and they might as well have been in my room.... the walls are very thin and you can hear everything. The breakfast left a lot to be desired.... day old bread and canned fruit, stale cereal and room-temperature milk to go on it. At least the coffee was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Rome again, we will stay at Corona again”
Reviews.Author: Mokummers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, nice, clean rooms, good bathroom. The people at the reception are friendly and helpfull. We liked the breakfast: the fresh sandwiches, the fresh cheese and ham and the marmelades and last, bus not least, the cakes. The "breakfast lady" worked very hard. She is friendly as well. That the hotel is situated at a distance op 10 minutes of Termini is clear: already 47 other reviews told this. We walked a lot and Corona is a good point to start your day. Building up the market in front of the door starting at 5 in the morning was a little noisy. But we closed the windows then untill 8 oclock. Then it was nice to see already so many people walking to the market.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad manned host”
Reviews.Author: CC888
Reviews.Content: Location - just 10 minutes walk from Termini station, walking distance to many attractions like S. Maria Maggiore Church (for the Catholics-must go to this beautiful church), we even walked to Colosseo, Pantheon, Piazza di Spagna, Fontana di Trevi etc, not too hard as we enjoyed the historic scene all around. Supermarket - we always returned late at night (after 9 to 10pm), we visited the Conad Supermarket at Termini Station every night for supplement of fruit, water, yoghurt etc. It closes at midnight, you can even buy fresh baked pizza and fresh roasted chicken here. Later, we found one local supermaket - Tuodi, very nearby to Corona Hotel. It located at the end of Via Urbana, no big brand identification, buy you can see many local people walk-in and out and carried its plastic bag with its shop name. Its price was much cheaper then Conad (the one in Termini Station). For example, the cheapest water of 1.5L here was just selling Euro 0.19 while Conad was selling Euro 0.65 (of course different brands), for 1 kg of fresh peach, Tuodi was selling Euro 0.49 while Conad was selling Euro 1.99. But Tuodi closes 8:30pm daily and even more earlier on Sunday. Conad's open hour is more convenient for night shoppers. Termini Station - It is a big shopping mall as well, different cafes and restaurants, 2 big bookshops, boutiques etc. We bought EuroStar train tickets here to visit Firenze and Pisa by using the ticketing machines. Daily market near to hotel - Our room were faced to the main entrance located at 4/F, we didn't hear any noise from the market in front of the hotel. It's a lovely market selling cheap local things, like fruit, clothes, shoes etc. Just operating for a few hours from early morning and all stalls close before 11am. The first day when we arrived at around 10 o'clock something in the morning, only the fruit stalls were still operating. Bad-manned host - There was a lady in the hotel lobby when we firstly arrived (may be the wife of the host because it is a family run hotel). She's nice but once she knew that we were travelled together with our 9 years old daughter, she seemed frustrated and called out the host - Mr. Luciano (the father). After she told him our case, Mr. Luciano got mad and lost his temper at once. He yelled to us that we needed to pay extra Euro 40 per night for our daughter. We kept smiling and explained to him peacefully that we bought an airline package in Hong Kong, the package already included air-tickets and hotel charges for three of us, we should not pay any extra in Rome. I even pointed to him that three of our names were shown on our hotel vouchure, I told him that we didn't cover the truth. But he's still keeping angry and shown his order booking form (from their Europe agency) to us. In his order booking form, only my husband and my name were shown, so he insisted we needed to use a Triple room instead of a Twin room. As we booked 4 nights there, so I suggested that I could share bed with our daughter and my husband sleep in another bed. But he kept to yell to us that child over 2 years old is not allowed to share bed with parents in their hotel. I turned a little bit angry up to this moment because of his bad-temper not because of the extra-pay he asked, I didn't want to lose my temper as well, so I use my mobile to dail a long distance call to our travel agency in HK to clarify this case. He promised to verify with their Europe agency and call later. So, my husband told Mr. Luciano that we only pay the extra when we check out. Then Mr. Luciano started to show his first smile to us and promised we could settle the extra payment when check-out later. Our HK agent settled this case with the Europe agent later, we didn't need to make any extra payment. We were luckied to meet both good service HK and Europe agencies, but we were not in luck to meet this bad-manned Mr. Luciano once we arrived Rome. Please pay attention that there may be more then two Mr. Luciano working in this hotel, may be father and son(s). For those young men we met when we returned lately at night (they usually stay in the night shift at Reception lobby) were very nice and good manned. Hotel FREE Gift - In Corona's web site, they wrote : "GIFTS: for who stays at least 4 days has a free reservation in Villa Borghese gallery and a free Wifi card with un limited connection!" (you can read this even up-to-date : Sep-09). When we asked the reception lady (the lady we first met when we checked-in) about the FREE Wifi card, she turned her face and replied no FREE Wifi card, customer need to pay (seemed Euro 5 / hour) to use their Wifi at lobby. I explained as we noted a free Wifi card would be provided during our stay, so we brought along with our own notebook PC and wanted to use it in our room, but she insisted no such service. So we gave up to ask anymore. Our Room - the room was small-sized, after placed a double bed (combined 2 single beds) and a single bed, not much area left. A single bed just around 2.5 feet width, may not very comfort for big people. Bath room was OK, 2 pcs of soap and a hanging holder with liquid soap were provided, you need to bring along your own amenities. See photo attached. Housekeeping - promptly and efficiency. But they didn't change any white bed sheets as well as the pillow cases during our 4 days stayed. They just made them good, we found they were all have goffer every night when we returned. See attached photo. Room safe - it's very small only fit for two purses only, the smallest safe I ever seen in the hotels around the places I travalled. Guest need to pay to use it (seemed Euro 5 per night), it's unreasonable. Mini Bar - no Mini Bar was found in the room, as we were visiting during hot summer, we were disappointed for we could not keep any cold drink in the room. Even no beverage vending machine in the hotel, you better buy them from the supermarkets metioned above. Hotel breakfast - a very elegant and nice breakfast room, very diligent and good-mannered ladies were working there. They were very busy during the breakfast time, not easy to find a seat during peak hour (after 9am) on weekend. My first favourite was their fruit bowl, freshly cutted, many different kinds of fruit were included (I always saw the ladies refilled all other food frequently but not included this fruit bowl). I also loved their pie very much, 3 flavours - blueberry, cheery and caramel. Pies, breads, rolls, ham, corn flakes, juice, coffee, tea were served, a good start for us in a day. MAP - Ask for a FREE map at the reception (their map was good to read) before you can find the tourism centre. This hotel is not bad at its price in Rome, but better-mannered service is important to the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- right price and location”
Reviews.Author: pattyi
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel, the owners spoke perfect English and advised us where to go, eat, and what to see. The hotel is on a small side street(Via Napoli) in the heart of the city so its quiet but has easy access to everything. We shopped Via Nationale(we could afford) and walked to the forum. Public transportation was great and we saw the Spanish steps,Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Summicron
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Large bathroom. Quiet. Clean. Safe area. Plain breakfast but free and great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “A great central place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GlenIrisVoyages
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune to have our pasports stolen in Sicily so had to return to Rome to apply for temporary pasports before we could continue our travels. We stayed at Corona Hotel which is centrally located and about 10 minutes walk from Termini Station and in view of the Opera House. We found the hotel to be comfortable and clean. The breakfast was one of the best we had during our 5 weeks in Italy. We enjoyed being able to look out the window in the morning and see what the weather forcast might be for the day and also to see if it was a street market day. We were on the third floor so it was also very quiet. We had close access to laundramat, banks and sights etc and found that the staff gave very good advice. The restaurant (next door) served great food at reasonalbe prices and best of all we could not get lost on the walk back to our hotel at night. We would certainly stay here when we are in Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, friendly and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Stylishbroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for people getting off a train into Termini. It's close the one of the main streets, Nazionale, as well as the Repubblica Piazza/metro stop (short walking distance). It is run by a charming and friendly family and they take great pride in their hotel. It has a lovely outdoor Market where goods can be bought right outside the door (request a room off of this street if you're a light sleeper). The bed is comfortable, the bathroom is very clean and the room is big enough with a closet for clothes. The breakfast was delicious with breads, cereals and meat (I believe it was Capiccola) with jams and pastries as well as coffee, tea and juices. They have internet service available in the lobby area through wi-fi. Bring your own computer though. There is an Internet service down the street if you don't have a computer and I believe the cost was a few Euros for an hour. All in all, it is a GREAT value in Rome and is a true hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Courteous staff. Comfortable at reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: SanGeminiPreserv
Reviews.Content: We have been using the Hotel Corona for several years and find it very well located for historic monuments and the center of Rome. The staff are very helpful and courteous. These are comfortable facilities at a moderate price. We continue to return every year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and good value”
Reviews.Author: sigmaone
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Large breakfast room downstairs. Only continental breakfast available. Easy walking distance to Termini (Central station) and buses. Good restaurants nearby...one next door. Daily market at end of street, cheap but quality fruit and vegetables.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Nice Staff, Good Rates..No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Huffaduff
Reviews.Content: Location:- Arrived at hotel after 10 minute walk from Central Termini Train Station. Within 5 minutes walk West of Hotel you will find the Santa Maria Basillica which is close to numerous pubs (the Stepping Stone and Druids Rock)...Within 5 minutes walk to East you will find the busy street of Via Nazionale with shops, bars and restaurants... Staff:- One of concerns I had in booking this hotel were reviews of staff particularly front door staff. But they couldn't be faulted in the helpfulness and willingness to oblige requests, such as allowing me a late checkout on the day of my departure. Night Porter available to let me into hotel in the early hours and the staff were always asking for keys which greatly enhanced my feeling of secuirty. Rooms:- Small enough rooms albeit very clean. Roomcleaning staff very prompt each morning to over cleaning services and extra towels etc. Slight smell of smoke from previous occupants though opening window quickly got rid of smell. Both twin and double rooms seem same size just pulling beds apart changes room from one to other. Facilities:- Wireless available at a charge (€5 for duration of stay) but wireless only worked on lower floors 1 and 2. Taxi arrangable at front desk. Breekfast available too but I did NOT avail of service as too busy sleeping off night before. Overall:- For price I paid (booked via third party website) I am more than pleased with hotel. As far as I'm aware the last minute rate can be got for €45 each person per night, which considering the superb location and helpfulness of staff was a complete bargain over a combined valentines / 6 nations rugby weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debjPhx
Reviews.Content: What a lovely group of people. From the moment we entered the door they were there to assist and help in anyway, from our computer needs to assisting in day to day activities. The rooms are small but very clean. This is not a new building by any means, but it is on a side street with an outdoor market during the day and it is Very Quiet at night which is a big plus for Rome. We walked to and from the train station. Can't say enough about the employee's, great place to stay and close to everything! Try the Irish Bar down the street, again great people! Had a great continental breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, Hotel Corona!!!”
Reviews.Author: RENISPIS
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome and it couldn't be any better! EVERY ONE ate HOTEL CORONA was very, very friendly and made me and my mother felt like it was HOME! They helped us with directions, they were supportive. And the best think, hehehe: I forgot my favorite sunglasses in a store, THEY WENT THERE AND MAILED IT TO MY HOUSE IN BRAZIL!!! I'm really happy and thankful for being there. CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YOU AGAIN!!! Love from Brazil...

Reviews.Title: “See Rome and walk”
Reviews.Author: MrsVAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Managment of this hotel was extremely helpful, before my visit started in their e-mail communication. Upon my request they ordered tickets for the Opera, booked excursions, made taxi reservations. The hotel is situated near the Piazza de la Republica, a metro station entrance. The street is very quiet. A restaurant and Irish pub are next door.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Livingstonlovely
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family trip to Italy and one of the best places that we stayed was the Corona in Rome. The front desk staff is friendly and they will do anything to help you have a great stay. From restaurant recommendations to sightseeing suggestions to calling taxis, they are always there to help. The rooms are very clean as is the breakfast area. The location is also very convenient to the trains and buses, and many things are walking distance. We traveled with three older children and found the hotel really met our needs. The only downside is the markets across the street which they set up (quite noisily) early in the morning. This did not bother my children because their room did not face the street and husband and I were so tired from sightseeing that it really did not matter to us, but if you're a light sleeper who wants to sleep late, you might want to stay in a room toward the back of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BDiaz
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Rome at the Hotel Corona. We landed at the hotel Corona, because our original hotel (Hotel Miami) had a problem with our room. The Hotel Miami’s staff told us that they had a room for us at la Corona. It was just a couple of blocks away. The Hotel Corona is a 10 minutes walk from the Termini Station. This hotel is located in an old building. When we arrived there, they gave us the apartment. This is a double room with a private bathroom. We were only 2 people; therefore this accommodation was enormous for us. The beds were very comfortable. The room and the bathroom were very clean. Our room was facing the street but the windows were soundproof, therefore, we did not have any noise coming from the outside.
