The hotel has a small lift, we did not use it but I think that no more that 2 people can fit in that lift. The people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. We did not have any problems with check in or check out. Regarding their breakfast, I think that they can improve it. They only offered a variety of breads, cereal, juice and coffee. This hotel does not offer internet service, but I found an internet café a block away from the hotel. Next to the hotel is a trattoria, food was good, but service was a little bit slow, even for Italian standards. If we go back to Rome, I know, I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Roma!!”
Reviews.Author: artist_julian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Corona in Roma, Italia Sept. 10, 2007. Hotel Propietor, Luciano, was so gracious and accomodating to us, making our stay there very enjoyable. The rest of the staff was nice as well, recommending restaurants, telling us where the nearest ATM and internet cafes were, etc. The location of the hotel is close to Termini and the many wonderful sights Roma has to offer. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Being an artist, I especially enjoyed the various artwork throughout the hotel!! We have been to Roma several times before and had wished we had then known about Hotel Corona. We will definitely recommend Hotel Corona to our friends. Ciao! Bettie Rikansrud from Julian, California

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanitaer
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our hotel. The desk people were friendly, and helpful right at check-in to check-out. The hotel was well located and the room was very clean. We had no problem with the air conditionaing like some other reviews. I was with my wife and two kids, and it was great relief to retreat to the room from the heat. The breakfast was fine with me. We came with the train into Rome and it was really close to Stazione Termini. We were able to walk to all most of the attractions, and took the bus and metro to the others. I feel bad for those who had a bad experience, but that just was not the case for us.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a headache!”
Reviews.Author: shan5839
Reviews.Content: After a 9 hour flight from Chicago, we arrived in Rome and had already set up transportation to the hotel that we had reservations at, Hotel Sonya. When we got there, they say there was a problem with our room and that we would have to stay at their sister hotel, Hotel Corona. After walking down the street to Hotel Corona, we were greeted by 2 men, and older and a younger one. The younger man was very helpful in explaining where the things were that we wanted to see and how to get there. After discussing how and when we were going to pay for our room, the older man then tried to tell us that the room would be 20 euro more than our original room at Hotel Sonya. Once this was finally cleared up and we refused to pay the extra money, we headed up to our room on a very tiny elevator. While resting, other guests walked into our room after being told that it was theirs. After sweating in our very hot room, we complained about there being no air conditioning. The old man at the front told us they might turn it on later if it got hotter. It had to be at least 90 outside! We dealt with no air conditioning the first night and left out window open. I didn't sleep one bit because it was so loud outside. The next day we complained again about it. The old man went upstairs to "fix it" and told us that it would start to work later, which it never did. The breakfast was not very good - the only thing I found to eat that I liked was a couple of bananas. The room and bathroom were normal sized, and there is a market place that opens in the morning right next to the hotel that was nice to go to, but other than that, this hotel and its staff were the pits. This hotel is very disorganized and they will tell you anything just to make you stop complaining to them. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: cortesc71
Reviews.Content: I believe this is one of the places in Italy that can remain in business due to so many tourists in the city. Otherwise it would've gone out of business a long time ago. My wife and I traveled throughout Europe for 3 weeks. Of all the hotels we stayed in this was the most expensive and by far the worst! I'd choose the tiny hotel in Florence where I had to carry my luggage 3 floors since there was no elevator anytime over this one. The service is horrible, starting from the reservations manager who could care less if you come or not and will tell you that in your face. Don't dare call them for info since they will hang up on you since they're so busy. The shower stunk like rotten water and had mildew stains all over. The shower door was broken also which caused to floor to get flooded. We called to have it fixed and in 5 days they could not even clean it. So we had to buy cleaning products and do it our self and ask for extra towels so we can put them on the floor for the water not to get into the bedroom. There is a market right in front so if you call for a cab you better have them pick you up in the corner. A DUMP filled with guests who think they're coming to a 3 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “not to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: B-Belle
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome to find the hotel we thought we had booked was not expecting us and was full so we had to set about finding somewhere else to stay. Being 2 couples, we secured 2 rooms for the first night of our 3 night stay in Hotel Sonia which I would recommend as a pleasant and friendly hotel and well worth it's 3 stars. However, they did not have rooms for the next 2 nights and we managed to get those at Hotel Corona just around the corner. We had to take a family suite - 2 rooms with shared bathroom but we were desperate! The reception looked ok but the rooms weren't very nice - the bedcover was stained and torn, there were no mirrors apart from the bathroom and the decor was generally unpleasant. I would say though that the bathroom was clean although having to go through our friends room to use it was awkward at times. There is a good little market outside in the mornings but this did lead to a good deal of noise in the early hours - this could be blocked out by shutting the double glazing but also the air (didn't try the air-con but sounds from other reports as if it might not have worked anyway!) Our friends room did not have any double-glazing. The breakfast I could not eat - the muesli tasted very strange and was probably old and the coffee was disgusting. I didn't go down next day but apparently they hadn't even re-filled the muesli container. We requested a toilet roll before we went out in the evening as the staff hadn't left a spare and we were fast running out! When we returned we asked again and the owner made a huge fuss about it and was very rude. He said why hadn't we asked in the morning - well if we had known we weren't going to be left one we might have . . . anyway I thought you were paying a hotel to cater to your needs. We also heard another guest asking for soap and towel, as they weren't in the room, and he was getting the same treatment! When we came to pay for our stay the receptionist said "don't you have any cash?" when I presented a card for payment. What a place!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, A-C doesn't work, bed location,ourdoor vegetable market near entran”
Reviews.Author: Tzabar59
Reviews.Content: Never seen a worse hotel in Rome. Keys for doors are the simplest (50 years old). Keys stuck. The air-condition in one of our rooms did not work for 2 days though we reported the problem immediately. the forniture was old. The attitude of the stuff was insulting. Every worker told us we should discuss things with the owner. The owner had a very bad attitude. only one old elevator which was sufficient for one person with a suitcase. I n one word... Shamefull... Disgusting! Einhorn Family

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Corona an awful place”
Reviews.Author: tomadi
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anybody. The owner, Luciano is a bad mannered, rude person. (If you don't like it you should have gone to a 4 star hotel was his favourite saying). Upon arrival, following a 12 hour flight from Singapore we were told to put our luggage into the corner as we would have to wait until 12 noon (3hours) for our room to be ready. When I asked if this could be a little sooner he told me he did not like the look on my face and that I could take my hotel voucher and get out of his hotel. It was only after I was about to fing the Rome number of the agency who I booked through (and paid for the room in advance) that suddenly my room was ready. The air conditioning was turned off ("for maintenance") every day even though it has been paid for. There were many complaints from other guests from all over the world. I would not advise anyone to use this noisy, unpleasant dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little hotel”
Reviews.Author: zekenz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Corona Hotel for 2 1/2 days at the end of April 2006. This was our first trip to Rome. Our travel agent booked the hotel although i had requested closer to the Trevi Fountain. So I had concerns about the location right from the start. I had read that by the termini was a bad area. We were pleasently surprised. Like a previous post, we arrived at 8 am and had to leave our bags in the lobby. I did feel a little uneasy but the bags were still locked from the flight and they are stored quite a way inside the hotel (not just sitting by the door) also there is someone on reception. The staff were not over friendly but still pleasent. (we found that alot in Rome) The elevator was small and we both couldn't fit with our luggage but that was no big deal. (actually will give us a laugh whenever we think of it) The room was basic with a decent size bathroom. The room was clean and the breakfast was good. The hotel is close to the metro which we used to get everywhere. (Spanish Steps, Barberini, Vatican City, Colosseum) From the Colosseum we walked back to the hotel via Roman Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and we didn't find it too strenuous. We walked to and from the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon several times. We're not extreamly fit but we were prepared to walk a fair amount. We would most probably stay here again as the location for us was ideal. I think you could book this hotel without too much concern. Afterall you're only going to sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in Rome..”
Reviews.Author: katr0713
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a few days in Rome, and I hope that the staff of the Hotel Corona will read this review. I booked tickets over a month in advance and didnt start looking for a hotel until much later. To my dismay, there was not only a marathon going on, but a rugby tournament as well, and everything everywhere was booked. The morning of my flight, I called the Hotel and was thankful to speak to Luciano. He secured rooms for me and my friends (for the night). The next day, he was able to secure rooms for us for the duration of our stay. The hotel is a simple 10 minute walk from the train station, and although it is a bit of a walk to the main tourist attractions, there is lots of good shopping in the area. If you are looking for an excellent restaurant, go no farther than outside the hotel and right next door to the left. If you like a bit of spice, the alio, olio and peperoncino (oil, garlic and chili pepper) pasta is awesome. The rooms, although quite small were clean, as was the bathroom. Breakfast is adequate, cold cereal, pastry, bread, coffee, tea and juice. I think the entire staff speaks english, and I found them to be very friendly and helpful. Luciano is my hero - without him, we'd have been sleeping on the street, so grazie, amico. Yes, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy location and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reception and breakfast friendly and adequate. We found the location very uninspiring and encountered several beggars and street drinkers on our short walk from Termini to Via Napoli. Room overlooking syreet was small and poorly lit with a badly sprung bed. The market outside starys setting up very early in the morning! But we got a good deal on the room rate and once accustomed to Rome it became and accessible base with quite good and numerous inexpensive restaurants nearby. we would probably look further north in the city next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just had four nights at this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. The room although fairly small (but then you only sleep in it) was exceptionally clean as was the shower room. Five minutes easy walking from the Termini where there is a direct train to the airport. Good position for sightseeing either on foot or using the metro (five minute walk). Buffet breakfast was adequate. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I felt this hotel had a nice presentation at first - but in the end it was a very poor accommodation. I stayed here for a few weeks with a school group and unfortunately most of the staff treated us as a nuisance. Some rooms were OK - but others were very poor as they were small and uncomfortable. The room should be clean if you are there one night, but if the stay is any longer they do not keep the rooms very tidy. The breakfast is lots of bread and grapefruit juice - so if you like that, you will enjoy it. The location is all right if you want to be by the train station, but it might be slightly difficult to find as it is located on a side street that only goes through on one side. I still have a bad taste in my mouth from this stay, as did most of my group - so I would recommend for the money they charge...please do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. Rome is incredible and beautiful so enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central - friendly and helpful staff speaking English”
Reviews.Author: encounterbay
Reviews.Content: 10 mins walk from Train/bus station - no need for taxi. Friendly staff who are helpful too. Buffet breakfast was adequate and average. Huge shower room, exceptionally clean. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay near railway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2004. The hotel was basic but adequate and clean. The continental breakfrast was okay. It is good value for a Rome hotel. It is located near to the railway station in Rome (within walking distance). Very good place to stay if you are just staying in Rome for a night before leaving by train to go somewhere else. You can walk to the ancient centre, but it is a fairly long way. Although, there is a good bus service from the railway station. I'd stay here again for a night if I wanted to be near the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Corona was okay. It was much farther from town than we expected, but it still was not bad. If I go back to Rome, I would stay somewhere closer to the tourist attractions and not so far away. It is definintely walkable, but it is located on a small, small sidestreet, so it is difficult to find at night or really anytime. The rooms were nice. The breakfast was terrbible, as they didn't have much to choose from. Also, they had no where to store bags all day. That was the main thing I did not like. We had a 7 pm flight and checkout is at 10 am. We wanted to go to the Vatican all day, but large bags are not allowed. He told us to just sit them in the lobby and they will be fine. I didn't really like the idea of that. They could at least have a room where they store it so it is not on display to everyone. There are a lot of pickpockets in Rome, so I did not trust this at all. They are also supposed to provide you with tour info and maps and they did not. It was okay overall, but I would not stay there again. For the price we paid, we could have gone elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Corona Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Napoli 3 | 00184 Roma, 00184 Rome, Italy
